intro: Chaenorhinum microcentron, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in various regions across Europe and parts of Asia. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is notable for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
